resources.string: It can get quite warm in Chennai, so ensure that you carry a bottle of water with you at all times
Always carry your personal ID card with you
The weather can be quite unpredictable; ensure that you read the forecast before you start your day

Most of the religious heritage sites in Chennai require visitors to dress in a specific attire, and remove any footwear before entry. Make sure you are aware of the rules before you visit these sites.
Smaller shops are less likely to have an ATM/Credit card payment provision with them, so make sure you have enough change to spare.
While auto rickshaws are fun to travel in, the drivers often charge a lot more than it actually costs. Ask a local guide before riding one.
The Bay of Bengal (the sea seen from the shore) is know for its strong currents and swimming is not advisable
Most of the locals speak fluent English, so you won\'t find communication a problem here :)
While you\'re travelling in Chennai, don\'t forget to take a ride in an auto rickshaw! These three wheeled glorified cycles are a lot of fun and a convenient way to explore the city!
Be sure to watch a traditional Indian performance in Mylapore, the cultural centre of Chennai! There are dance performances, Carnatic music shows and classical art displays here throughout the year!
Chennai\'s largest multiplex cinema complex has 6 levels of theatres and a 3D cinema for you to enjoy a movie during your stay in Chennai.
The Marina Beach is India\'s longest natural urban beach, and is as beautiful as it\s name suggests... A must visit for every tourist in Chennai!

Marina Beach is the longest natural urban beach in India. A sandy beach, it stretches for 6.45km along the coast of the Bay of Bengal. This beach attracts over 30,000 visitors a day! Be sure to visit this beautiful beach before or after the midday sun, to avoid sunburn! Evenings are made colourful here with the kite flying and beach volleyball competitions.

Guindy National Park is a National Park of India. It plays a role in in-situ and ex-situ conservation of wildlife. This park is situated near the Raj Bhavan, which is the official residence of the Governor of TamilNadu. Covering an area of 2.7 squar kilomaters, this famous park attracts over 700,000 visitors a year!

Kapaleeshwar Temple is a temple devoted to the Hindu God, Lord Shiva. This temple was built in the 7th century CE, by the Pallava Kings of South India. The temple architecture is amazing and the wall paintings inside the temple depict many Hindu religious tales. The temple houses numerous shrines, which make this temple\'s structure one of the most complex in the world.

Fort St. George was the first British fortress built in India. Founded in 1644, it was initially intended to house European traders and settlers. It is currently the legislative assembly of Tamil Nadu. On these premises you can find St. Mary\'s church which is the oldest Anglican church in India, constructed between 1678 and 1680

Birla Planetarium is a large astronomical planetarium situated in Chennai. It was established in 1988, and is known to be the most modern planetarium in India. It houses state-of-the-art infrastructure and equipment for astronomical studies. Virtual tours of the night sky are also arranged here.
